definition: Hong Taiji (1592-1643), eighth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, reigned 1626-1636 as Second Khan of Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金, then founded the Qing dynasty 大清 and reigned 1636-1643 as Emperor/posthumous name 清太宗
emperor/old variant of 惶[huang2]
surname Huang
highest/greatest/too (much)/very/extremely
extremely/pole (geography, physics)/utmost/top
Hung Taiji (1592-1643), eighth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, reigned 1626-1636 as Second Khan of Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金, then founded the Qing dynasty 大清 and reigned 1636-1643 as Emperor
pinyin: Huang2 tai4 ji2 Qing1 tai4 zong1

sentences.english: Huang taiji at noon on the second day if the killer is not on the monkey to justice was put to death on her.
sentences.chinese: 皇太极下旨第二日中午如果凶手还不归案就处死玉儿。

sentences.english: Sea LanZhu coma lying in bed, defends huang taiji in the bedside old a lot.
sentences.chinese: 海兰珠一直昏迷躺在床上，皇太极守在床边苍老不少。

sentences.english: The Huang Taiji Period was the important stage that the Qing Dynasty political power turned from armed administration to literary administration.
sentences.chinese: 皇太极时期是清朝政权由武治向文治转变的重要阶段。

sentences.english: A sharp struggle centred on the succession to the throne came along with the death of emperor Tai Zong (Huang Tai Ji).
sentences.chinese: 皇太极去世后，围绕皇位继承权展开了激烈的斗争。

sentences.english: Big on her know the twice to save her that his uncle huang taiji.
sentences.chinese: 大玉儿知道了两次救她的人就是自己的姑父皇太极。

sentences.english: The ministers see huang taiji so firm also dare to anger cant speak.
sentences.chinese: 众大臣见皇太极如此坚定也都敢怒不敢言。

definition: Dorgon (1612-1651), fourteenth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, successful general, instrumental in Manchu conquest of China, ruled China as regent 1644-1650 for his nephew Emperor Shunzhi 順治帝
Nurhaci (1559-1626), founder and first Khan of the Manchu Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金 (from 1616)
Wu Sangui (1612-1678), Chinese general who let the Manchus into China and helped them establish the Qing Dynasty, later leading a revolt against Qing in an effort to start his own dynasty
Later Jin dynasty (from 1616-)/Manchu Khanate or kingdom that took over as Qing dynasty in 1644
Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), grandson of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗, first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294

posthumous title of Hung Taiji 皇太極|皇太极 (1592-1643), eighth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, reigned 1626-1636 as Second Khan of Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金, then founded the Qing dynasty 大清 and reigned 1636-1643 as Emperor
reign name of second Qing emperor (1644-1662)
Fulin Emperor Shunzhi (1638-1662), second Qing emperor, reigned 1644-1662
Chongzhen, reign name of last Ming emperor (1628-1644)
Li Zicheng (1605-1645), leader of peasant rebellion at the end of the Ming Dynasty
Eight Banners, military organization of Manchu later Jin dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] from c. 1600, subsequently of the Qing dynasty
Zhu Di, personal name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
Ögedei Khan (1186-1242), a son of Genghis Khan
Khalkha, largest subgroup of Mongol people
Oirat Mongols (alliance of tribes of Western Mongolia) (Ming Dynasty term)
Hetu Ala (Manchu: Yellow Rock), Nurhaci's capital at the 1619 Battle of Sarhu
